【考法 1】 n. 前言：a preliminary statement or essay introducing a book that explains its scope, intention, or background and is usually written by the author
【例】 An informal brunch served as a preface to the three-day conference. 一顿非正式的便餐作为为期三天的会议的序曲。
【近】 exordium, foreword, introduction, overture, preamble, prelude, prologue
【反】 epilogue 尾声
【派】 prefatory adj. 序言的
【记】 前面的脸，书前面的脸就是序言
The greater the man, the more restrained his anger. 人越伟大，越能克制怒火。
